title: Impact of data synchronization methods on the quality of engineering NIS data from several integrated applications in GIS architecture
abstract: This study examines the impact of data synchronization techniques on the quality of network information system (NIS) engineering data from multiple integrated applications in a geospatial information system (GIS) architecture. As a case study has been chosen a grid power infrastructure to examine data synchronization impact on the data storage quality during NIS Plan and the mobile solution Plan interaction. Three different interaction scenarios have been considered and optimal solutions were proposed in accordance with business priorities.
venue: 2021 IEEE 9th Workshop on Advances in Information, Electronic and Electrical Engineering (AIEEE)

journal.name: 2021 IEEE 9th Workshop on Advances in Information, Electronic and Electrical Engineering (AIEEE)

citations.title: Analysis on RGB Dataset Requirements for Remote Inspection of Power Grid Infrastructure
